fields.summary: Using excerpt-include doesn't render the body in the {excerpt} macro when it contains {note} or {code} or {noformat}

fields.description:
(Original Title: cache-control: must-revalidate not always given on RTE Javascript response)

Explanation by Tom Davies: The Rich Text Editor Javascript is retrieved as a two-step process, and the generated Javascript is cached on the server.

The first set of Javascript to be returned needs to have a must-revalidate header to pick up changes in the base url Confluence is deployed at. The header was only being applied to responses where the cache was empty, not to all responses, so the rich text editor would fail to load for users who had incorrect javascript cached in their browser.
fields.summary: Rich-Text-Editor failed to load for some users

fields.description:
There is limited documentation available to help users with using the rich text editor to create tables. 

'Rich Text-Working with Tables' should have a screenshot-based tutorial on add a table.
'Working with Tables' should mention the rules used to construct tables in markup.
Both documents should be integrated better with each other and the main User Guide page.

- http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF20/Rich+Text-Working+with+Tables 
- http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF20/Working+with+Tables
fields.summary: Expand 'Working With Tables' document in User Guide

fields.description:
We've been running Confluence 2.2.9 for a while using the default global logo. After upgrading to 2.5.1, I decided to use our corporate logo as the global logo. After uploading and activating our global logo, we get random page load failures in Firefox 2.0.0.3. It manifests with Firefox prompting to download the page instead of display it (the content-type is set to application/octet-stream?). If i choose to download, the file does not get saved. I have not managed to reproduce the problem in IE 6. Switching back to the default global logo or turning off the global logo solves the problem. I see no exceptions in the log file (but full debug logging is not enabled). The access log reports no abnormal page responses (just 200, 302, and 304).

I've attached the file I use. Let me know what debug logs to turn up if anything may be of help.
fields.summary: new global logo causes random page load failures

fields.description: The browser (FF 2.0.0.3 & IE7.0.5) hangs when restricting pages in confluence. Look up of users and groups works, but when the add button is selected the page hangs.
fields.summary: The browser (FF 2.0.0.3 & IE7.0.5) hangs when restricting pages in confluence

fields.description: It would be really nice to customize what information is displayed on the users' personal profile based on information received from LDAP. For example, the phonenumber attribute could be pulled from LDAP and added to the existing information on the users' profile.
fields.summary: ability to update what is displayed in user profile from LDAP

fields.description: Once you create a custom color scheme under the Space Admin, the color changes take effect correctly.  However, when you try to select to go back to the global settings, the colors DO NOT change back.  The setting is saved as using the global color scheme, but the old custom colors are still set throughout the space.  The only way to set them back is to create a custom color sheme and click save.
fields.summary: Colour Scheme editing under the Space Admin does not reset correctly

fields.description:
We have a rather large confluence installation, running on a windows platform.
There are 80 spaces, each space has 3 corresponding LDAP groups defining administrators, editors and viewers.

After running the system for several days (approximately  a week) without any problems, the server stops responding.
When we monitor the memory usage, we see it slowly increasing all the time.
In the end, when the response time is very bad, we see the memory usage is at its max.
The garbage collector frees is only able to free a very small amount of memory.
The system needs a complete shutdown and reboot in order to serve our users again.

We think there might be a memory leak in some library used?
In the log files, we also see some other strange entries concerning lucene amongst others.
Can you guys confirm this, or help us debug why our installation has such a bad uptime.
fields.summary: Slow performance after running the server for several days (memory usages increases slowly until max reached)

fields.description: When using the toc macro with outline=true, the numbering of the outline is placed on the line before the heading information for that number is displayed (screen shot below).  This only happens with the outline format.
fields.summary: toc outline format adds a line break after each heading number

fields.description:
When using jiraissues macro following error is shown: Error rendering macro: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError
It was working before but after upgrade something seems to be broken.
used versions: confluence 2.4.5, jira 3.8
fields.summary: Error rendering macro: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError when using jiraissues macro

fields.description: You can't copy page or attachment links from the editor between pages or spaces. The wikimarkup for a link to an attachment on the same page doesn't mention the page or space. Therefore, when you paste that wikimarkup into a new page, confluence searches for an attachment of that name on the new page. The solution would be for a full path to be given for each attachment and page.
fields.summary: Have rich text link button provide full path info so text can be copied between pages and spaces

fields.description:
I have a new bug report for Confluence.

Go to Edit Space Permissions page for any space.
Click on the magnifying class to find a new client (see first screenshot).
It works fine in FireFox (v2.0.0.3) but, in IE (v7.0.6000.16448) I get an error on page message on the bottom of the screen and nothing happens. 

This worked fine in 2.4.2, but in 2.5.1 it's not working.
fields.summary: Edit Space Permissions failure in IE7 (works in FireFox 2.0.0.3)

fields.description:
Hello,

I think it would be useful to expire a page or a page family. Expiration means that the content on the page is only valid up to a certain date. 

I have seen discussions on this topic but am not sure if a formal enhancement request has been made.

The use cases would be:
1. User creates a page and defines an expiration date
2. When the expiration date is reached, the creator of the page and the Space Admins are notified that the page has reached expiration
3. The creator and Space Admins can then extend the expiration or commit it to an expired pool, in which case the page moves to a section in the Admin area of all expired content (can be viewed but not edited) and can be optionally purged.

Also, existing pages can be tagged for expiry.
fields.summary: Enable content expiry

fields.description:
When a group sets the permissions on a page to view and edit only for that group, the admin can view the page by typing in the url.  This should not be the case.  Many gourps want to post secure information and not allow the admin to view it.  

Knowing that the admin could remove the restrictions on the page and view the page is OK since we know that this could be detected.  But the ability for them to type in the url to a page and view it isn't acceptable.

I assume this affects all versions that allow page restrictions.
fields.summary: Admin can view a page, which is restricted to them by typing in the url to that page.

fields.description:
The default behaviour when using the rich text editor is that inserting a new line results in two new lines being inserted. This is violates user expectation of a single newline character producing in a single newline. Our behaviour of inserting a new paragraph instead is inconsistent with other programs.

The workaround is to press Shift + Enter instead of just Enter.
fields.summary: Pressing enter in Rich Text Editor jumps two lines instead of just one

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8519].
  {panel}

When using the RTE to add hyperlinks, leading spaces are deleted.

To replicate:
1) Edit page in Rich Text mode
2) Insert 'This is a link' as normal text
3) Use the cursor to select ' link' including the leading space
4) Use the Add Link option and add any link

The preceding space is now gone and the text has been changed to 'This is alink'.

Confirmed on IE, Firefox on Mac and PC
fields.summary: Rich Text Editor 'Add link' button deletes leading spaces

fields.description:
We are very interested in making use of the Scaffolding plugin to capture meta data values and table information that frequently undergoes reordering or alphabetizing (e.g., glossary terms). Unfortunately, the limitation that the content recorded within the Scaffolding table cannot be copied is a showstopper.

Given the severe limitations of the standard Confluence tables and inability to reorder rows of information, we think providing the ability to copy the content would be a significant enhancement to Confluence.
fields.summary: Allow the full content of the pages that contain dynamic task list or Scaffolding plugin information to be copied to another page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8513].
  {panel}

A several customer requests are as simple as "I started the startup.bat script and now Confluence is not running"

Perhaps adding a simple message on the startup screen as Crowd does may be helpful:

Below is an example of Crowd startup message:


*******************************************************************************
*
*  You can now use Crowd by visiting http://localhost:8095/crowd/console/
*
*******************************************************************************

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8511].
  {panel}

Tell me if I'm dreaming here...

Confluence already has a bit of its built in functionality plugin-ized. Plugins can be downloaded, replaced, restarted etc.

Why not move just about everything to plugins, and allow them to be upgraded via the plugin repository? This would let the app be self updateable, for all but the most core and basic stuff.
Database upgrades could be plugins as well, that run once.

You would need a way of grouping plugins so that all the new stuff for each release gets downloaded together as a group - otherwise you would have versioning hell.
Probably need a way of disabling the app while it is all happening too.

So the core app is very small, and contains bootstrap code and libs. Everything else is a plugin (included dependent jars?). Once the core app is installed once, all upgrades are done through the plugin manager. 

I wonder if something like osgi (which eclipse is built on now), would be of use here?

Confluence v3.0 ? (4.0?)
fields.summary: Auto upgrade framework

fields.description:
Currently if you run locked-down (login required) server you need to use your username and password to retrieve RSS feeds.  When using a 3rd party reader (such as Google Reader) this inevitably means exposing your global username and password.

Fisheye solves this by generating a hash during a user login which is then stored with the user details.  Only URLS containing this hash will authenticate.  Deleting this hash from the DB is effectively a global logout.  An additional bonus is that you can create hashes on a per-resource basis; you could create a hash for the RSS feed and one to enable an attachment to be accessible externally (e.g. an image) and the compromise of one does not mean the compromise of the other.
fields.summary: Secure, passwordless RSS feeds

fields.description:
The calendar plugin currently depends on version 1.4. Given the way that classes in Confluence dependencies are given precedence over jars bundled in plugins, this is causing the Calendar plugin to fail (as it is loading a version 0.98 class). 

We only have two usages of joda time. We construct a DateMidnight object in ContentEntityObjectHiberndateDao and AbstractHibernateAttachmentDao. The constructor that takes in a long parameter is still present in 1.4, so this is a safe upgrade.
fields.summary: Upgrade joda-time dependency from version 0.98 to version 1.4

fields.description:
Many users produce content in one language and need to maintain an up-to-date mirror of that content in another language. It would be useful to have a plugin that performs the following tasks
- automatically adds the label 'for-translation' when a page is edited
- add a new tab in Browse Space called 'Needs Translating' which lists all pages with the label 'needs-translating' and the last update date. Include a checkbox for each page plus 'Check All' to allows bulk marking as updated. 

Users will be able to mark a page as updated by deleting the for-translation label when viewing the page content. For themes that display a list of the page labels on the view tab, this only requires a doubleclick on the label delete. Users can use existing notification scheme to receive notifications when a page is labelled with 'needs-translating'.

Use Case 
1) User A updates a Page A in the English space as normal
2) User B is emailed is with page update notification, triggered by the label 'needs-translating' being added Page A
3) User B views Page A in one window while they edit Page B, which is the translation of Page A, in another window. When Page B has been updated, they click the delete button for the 'needs-translating' label on Page A

This is only one approach and attempts to use existing functionality as much as possible.
fields.summary: Add translation workflow to move updates in one space to a foreign language mirror

fields.description:
Diagnosis: - We attached a file named "Employee's Rules" to a page, where the ' character generates the URL code %E2%80%99 (I think it's U+2019, right single quote. This is what it looks like in word or outook, but not I.E.) - (note, we tried steps below with the ´ character U+00B4:Acute Accent Keystroke Alt+0180, and tést.txt, with the french e with an accent, and the regular apostrophe" - All files attached as expected, maintaining the special character - all can be linked to, and downloaded. The links are independent, in that the same file name only differing by ', U+0027, U+2019 and U+00B4 are unique. - however: -- renaming either the apostrophe (U+0027), backtick (U+00B4) or the e with an accent in "tést.txt" to test.txt works fine. -- trying to rename the special character U+2019 gave first a proxy error, then came back with a regular apostrophe (U+0027) in the attachment rename form. After we put in a new name and clicked ok, it told us the file was not found (although the origianl was obviously still there with the U+2019 still in the name). -- likewise, we can delete the U+0027 or U+00B4 or U+00E9, however, we cannot delete, using the 'remove' button, the attachment with the special backtick character. We get the same error: file not found. -- in the rename form, I get this HTML (without the pre tags)
-- where I would normally get -- -(so the $generalUtil.urlEncode($attachment.fileName) is obviously failing aswell) - also, pasting "//pages/removeattachmentonpage.action?pageId=9110025&fileName=test'.txt&version=1" in the address bar of IE does not work either. - This is a copy of the string causing the problem, but I'm not sure if it will make it through JIRA: "Manager's Roles and Responsibilities". I'm pretty sure it's a U_2019. -- note also: upload using webdav of any of these characters resulted in the sepcial characters being replaced by a 'block' loking character "t�st.txt". -- these then appear in webdav client (WebDrive) as t?st.txt, and cannot be deleted or accessed through that interface. They can, except for the U+2019, be removed from the web interface) Bottom Line: *SO I cannot currently delete or rename any file that contains a U+2019.* Error: - error generated: "The following error(s) occurred: The attachment specified does not exist. " Recommendation: 1) in web app, us the attachment ID to specify name of the attachment to rename or delete, not the text name 2) Either allow U+2019 for all actions, or filter consistantly between upload / rename / remove / webdav Appreciation: Thanks very much!
fields.summary: CLONE -using a special close single quote character in an attachment name permits upload and download and linking, but does not allow removal / rename (U+2019, U+00B4 and U+0027)

fields.description:
Currently, under 'Space > List Attachments', the option 'Filter By File Extension'  is case-sensitive.

This means that if you search for files with the extension 'png', and the physical filenames actually end in 'PNG', then the search will return nothing.

Also ... if, for example, some attachments in the space have the extension 'png' and others have the extension 'PNG', then searching for either 'png' or "PNG' returns an incomplete list.
fields.summary: under 'Space > List Attachments', make 'Filter By File Extension' non-case-sensitive

fields.description:
on a batch of pages for a given space, i had to change the parent page for each of them.  once done, i noticed that the page's 'last edited by <user> on <date>' line atop correctly reflected a change in who last edited the page (me), but the date in <date> was whatever the old date was.

this is a bit confusing and strange -- why is one changed, but not the other?  it is strange (and inaccurate) to say that i changed the page way back in the past.

thank you!
fields.summary: when changing parent page info of a page, page's 'last edited by' info changes username, but not the date?

fields.description:
attempting to attach new files to a page with several existing (jpg) attachments produced 'system error' page.

the user has tried to attach jpg, pdf, and xls files to no avail.  i have also tested jpg/txt/doc files to no avail.  i have tested attaching the same test files to various other pages within the same space, including the parent page itself (home), and several 'sibling' pages, which were all successful.

we are both in the correct confluence groups that this page's view/edit access is currently restricted to.

incidentally, our site has come across this/something very similar about 9 months ago while on version 2.1.5a.  the problem seemed to disappear when we upgraded to 2.2.7 around that time.  we are still on 2.2.7 at the time of this report, and it appears the problem has reappeared.  the workaround in case the original page was (still) corrupted, was to clone the page and reattach the files to the fresh clone page.  i've done this as well with the current problematic page, and new attachments appear to attach fine on the new, cloned page.

fields.description:
When I run a query for 'blargadsf type:page OR type:comment' a set of results is returned (should really be 0 results).  When I run ' asdfasf type:page OR type:comment' the same set of results as for the other query is returned (should also be 0 results).  This can easily be reproduced by running a query for something that doesn't exist in [Sage|search.atlassian.com].  

I've attached the XML req and response files to this issue.
fields.summary: XML-RPC interface returns the same results for a query that shouldn't produce any results
display Page Restrictions even when the page is not in Edit mode
Don't change my code, especially when it is within an {html} macro!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8476].
  {panel}

There used to be a way to change which TinyMCE buttons are shown, as was discussed in this forum posting:
http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257223319
Now when I open template/notable/wiki-textarea.vm I am unable to modify the buttons.
I want to add some of the other buttons that are part of TinyMCE, as shown here:
http://tinymce.moxiecode.com/example_full.php?example=true
I also want to remove some of the buttons that are standard in Confluence's implementation, such as emoticons.
fields.summary: Let me pick which buttons show up in TinyMCE editor

fields.description:
The {attachments} macro ignores the used localisation. Displaying the attachments in the space shows the translated table headers, while the macro always shows an english header (name, size, creator...).

Looking into the attachmentsmacro.vm from WEB-INF/lib/attachments-2.5.1.jar shows that the strings are all hardcoded.
fields.summary: Missing localisation in attachments macro

fields.description: If user configures a daily backup file name which collides with an existing backup, the backup file will not be overwritten.
fields.summary: Daily backup files not overwritten if daily backup file name is static

fields.description: Given that times have changed and blogs are now very well known amongst a wide business community, it is worth reviewing, and most likely changing, the name given to our current News functionality in order that it be reverted back to be named Blogs.
fields.summary: Change 'News' to 'Blogs'

fields.description: Display of last page number in PDF output does not work. According to FOP 1.1 information there is a syntax supporting this feature. However, this does not work in Confluence output.
fields.summary: Display of last page number in PDF output
Enable configuration of number of ancestors displayed in email notifications
Have ability to set the maximum number of attachments per page on a space by space basis

fields.description:
A customer reported that after upgraded to Confluence version 2.5.1, viewing members belongs to a group now output as class.getString(). Attached a screenshot (Groupmanage.jpg) is the result shown when trying to reproduce customer's problem. 

To reproduce:

# Go to Admin Console's Manage Groups
# Click on any of the group available
# Obtained a result as shown in the attached screenshot
fields.summary: Members of groups in Group Management are printed in ugly technical way

fields.description:
When perofrming a people search you never get any results. I tried searching for myself in three formats

Richard C. Tallini
Richard*
*Tallini

See attachment for results, as you can see I am there as my information is displayed as a favorite.

The only thing different is that our users are in a hibernate repository, not a standard repository, although I dont think that should matter.

*UPDATE* I decided as a last ditch effor to search by username and I got a hit, however most users will not think to search using a login ID, as most people dont know each other's user names
fields.summary: Trying to use peoplesearch always yeilds no results

fields.description:
I was excited to here that we would be able to restrict pages by individuals in 2.5 rather then the group limitation. My company wants the ability to be able to have pages, regardless of what space they live in that certain people are able to have access to. 

I was a bit disappointed when I started to play with 2.5 and this new page restriction feature because a user has to be part of the Space as a group or individual access in order to view a page that has been restricted to their account. 

From an Enterprise perspective I think it is important that if page access has been granted to a user for view and edit they are able to view that page regardless of what space it lives in.  

The interface currently allows you to choose any user in the system. This was very deceiving because it implies that I can add any user to a page but that is only true if that user has access to the entire space.  

Many organization are looking for ways to collaborate with people who are typically not part of their organization, are customers or vendors they work with.  In confluence this becomes challenging because you need to create a space every time you need to introduce someone that is not consider privilege to viewing public information.
fields.summary: Enhancement to 2.5 restrict page functionality

fields.description:
If a table contains text in a cell which is highlighted in colour, when a piece of text is selected subsequentally to add (via the WYSIWYG editor) a link (HTML reference) upon saving the published page is corrupted.

I believe the editor/publishing process get confused with the '|' delimiters across the table and the link and resolved them differently than presented in the editor. This is turn leads to the link be presented on the page directly (rather than as a reference with on the original text). The reference appears either in a different cell and often the row becomes one cell shorter than the rest of the table.
fields.summary: In the WYSIWYG adding a link to coloured text in a table corrupts the published view

fields.description: There are some users having problems with Confluence when they have performance monitoring tools (eg : Willy) installed. They believe this should be documented.
fields.summary: Information about  performance monitoring tools running with Confluence

fields.description: The links look like: file:///display/ds/Confluence+Overview
fields.summary: Links produced by the {index} macro aren't correct when a space is exported to HTML
An HTML export of a space containing a page named 'Index' loses the export's index.html file.

fields.description:
I'm exporting a space to HTML and I want to insert some specific stuff into each page generated.
So I edited both Export Layouts of the space (Browse Space > Space Admin > Layout).
But when I export the space, my changed aren't used, all pages are generated with the Default Layouts.

So, I tried and changed the Export Layouts on Site level (Dashboard > Administration > Look and Feel > Edit Site Layouts).
And now it works!

But why doesn't it work for the individual space.
I want to edit the export layout for each of my spaces to be different.

Another user was able to reproduce the failure.
fields.summary: Export Layouts don't work for Spaces, only for Site
Allow for unwatching multiple pages at a time

fields.description:
lines with "(" chars get truncated

Example: paste this link from microsoft.com using "markup" editor, save, and notice that hyperlink got truncated (though full text visible, everything after "(" is not part of the hyperlink)

http://msdn2.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa276862(SQL.80).aspx
fields.summary: Hyperlinks containing round brackets are broken

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a link using the Rich Text Editor dialog box. Link to a Confluence page (not an external URL, which doesn't seem to have this problem)
2. Save the document and watch the whitespace disappear (sometimes). NB. Sometimes even the entire link disappears.
fields.summary: Links created via the Rich Text Editor dialog lose the space character immediately after the link

fields.description:
I have been looking for quick integration of confluence and MS exchange. The use case is as follows

1) User will send an e-mail to a designated e-mail address. 
2) The e-mail address will be routed to the space/page based on the subject

Clearspace by jivesoftware and socialtext wiki provide this functionality.
fields.summary: Another quick question, I have been looking for quick integration of confluence and MS exchange. The use case will be as follows

fields.description:
The JavaMail APIs are included twice. Once as javamail-1.3.2.jar and once as mail-1.3.2.jar

This causes problems with configuring a JNDI mail server since the instructions only state that activation and javamail JARs need to be moved. Confluence continues to fail to send mail to the JNDI mail server until the mail JAR is removed as well.
fields.summary: Duplicate javamail / mail JARs

fields.description: On the user management page, if you click "Search" without entering results you get a java exception - see atachment
fields.summary: On the user management page, if you click "Search" without entering results you get a java exception

fields.description:
Upgraded from Confluence 2.4.4 to 2.5.

When managing groups and clicking on the group title to see which users belong to that group, I get a NullPointerException error.  When I create a new group and click on that group title, the listing works by showing no users. As soon as I assign a user the new group, going back to Manage Groups and clicking on the group title gives me a NullPointerException error.

This means any group with users assigned to it would give me that error.

fields.description:
Using the Rich Text editor, you can re-size an image in a page. However when you save your changes, the image is not re-sized.

It is worth noting that if you edit the page using Wiki Markup instead of Rich Text, you can specify width and height attributes on the image:

You can specify an absolute size, for example:
{code}
   !image.jpg|width=640px, height=480px!
{code}

So the hooks are in place to get it working from the Rich Text editor.

Cheers,
Ian
fields.summary: Rich Text editor lets you resize an image, however changes are not saved

fields.description: Sometimes when I export (either PDF or HTML), I want to export a page hierarchy that is a subset of an existing space. However, the Export Space tool forces me to select each of the pages in the subtree individually. It would be better if there were an additional "select subtree" check box that allowed you to select/deselect a parent page and all of its children/grandchildren at once.
fields.summary: Export space tool: make it easier to select or deselect a subtree of a space

fields.description:
Quite often, I edit in the Rich Text Editor because it gives me an easier way to navigate around content (especially when I'm using tables). But, when I want to enter a macro in the page, I need to move to the Wiki Markup editor. By making the transition, I lose my context, and have to search through the document to locate the section where I want to insert the macro.

This improvement would not be as necessary if you could implement improvement: (CONF-8442) Make it possible to use macros in the Rich Text Editor
fields.summary: Remember context when moving between Rich Text Editor and Wiki Markup editor

fields.description:
Quite often, I want to be able to use macros from within the Rich Text Editor. However, it's not possible to enter all macros in this editor, as the brace characters ("{" and "}") are automatically escaped by the editor.

Can you supply a special escape character sequence (or, better put, a "do not escape" character sequence) that indicates to the Rich Text Editor that it should not escape the brace characters with the backslash?
fields.summary: Make it possible to use macros in the Rich Text Editor

fields.description: I have some users who like to use the {html} tag in their pages, using the Wiki Markup editor. However, when another user who is more familiar with the Rich Text Editor attempts to edit the page (using the Rich Text Editor), the formatting gets corrupted. This was especially the case when the original editor used HTML tables within the {html} tag.
fields.summary: Rich Text Editor messes up formatting of pages that use the {html} tag
Rich Text Editor loses context when you backspace over an empty paragraph

fields.description: When you click the Undo button or use Control-Z in the Rich Text Editor, the editor loses context and jumps to the top of the page. This is disconcerting when you are scrolled down to the bottom of a large document.
fields.summary: Rich Text Editor loses context when you click Undo

fields.description: In the Rich Text Editor, when you are editing a table on a large page (where you have scrolled to the bottom), if you add or remove a row or column using the table edit buttons, the editor loses context and jumps you to the top the of page.  This is very frustrating, especially when you want to add multiple rows or columns to your table.
fields.summary: Rich Text Editor loses context when you add or remove a row or column from a table

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8437].
  {panel}

Customer is working on a system to synchronize our Confluence groups from an external source.

RPC methods needed by customer:

Vector getUsersInGroup(String token, String groupname)
void removeAllUsersFromGroup(String token, string groupname)
fields.summary: Add group-related functions like get users in group to remote API

fields.description:
We are using confluence to manage various project documentation, including some proposals and requirements documents.  We have done some tweaking of the PDF templates, but we have need of some additional formatting macro so that we can create page breaks in Confluence pages.  The specific need is to be able to create cover pages and more precisely control the paging of exported pages.

I apologize if this is somehow already possible or has been documented.  I was unable to find any reference to such a feature or existing open issue describing this problem.
fields.summary: Add support for page breaks in PDF page exports

fields.description: During daily backup no disk space left and the length of confluence.cfg.xml became 0. I tried to restore confluence.cfg.xml from a previous backup but it does not contain it although this config file resides in the data directory and cerated by confluence.
fields.summary: confluence.cfg.xml missing from backup

fields.description:
The steps for reproducing this bug are:

1) Insert a link from the "Insert link" icon on the rich-text editor and then go to the "Attachment" tab and click on "Browse" to upload an attachment that has not already been attached to that page.
2) Then click on the "OK" button and the exception is generated. Attached the stack trace.
3) Go back to the same upload attachment screen again, the attachment is already present there. A screenshot has been attached.
fields.summary: ConfigurationException when attachments are uploaded from the "insert link" icon on rich-text editor

fields.description:
Exporting a large space from Confluence to PDF can use a massive amount of CPU and cause Confluence to become much less responsive until the export is complete.


I previously thought this was causing Confluence to become completely unresponsive, but in fact there is another culprit for this.
fields.summary: XML Export of large space uses lots of CPU
Add a URI to content feeds

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8427].
  {panel}

In the help docu you wrote:
"Imports and displays JIRA issue list RSS as inline content for the page. You can easily customize the list and order of the columns being displayed, by specifying columns parameter.

Not specifying columns will lead into the default column list and order. 

Allowed columns are: key, summary, type, created, updated, assignee, reporter, priority, status, resolution. "

Please allow also columns like "Component" & "Versions".

Thank you,
Gunter.
fields.summary: Please add additional columns for import of Jira issues into a wiki page

fields.description:
Clicking on Preferences->Edit Profile->Email->Cancel leads to a blank screen - http://localhost:8080/users/doeditemailpreferences.action

The user has to click on the "Back" arrow to go back to the Email page.

The "Cancel" action should instead take you to this page : http://localhost:8080/users/viewuserprofile.action

I could not reproduce this bug in Version 2.4.5 though, where the browser is redirected to the correct page as specified above.
fields.summary: Clicking on Preferences->Edit Profile->Email->Cancel leads to a blank screen

fields.description:
Removing a group via RPC that has space permissions throws an exception when visiting the space afterwards. This is caused by the space permissions cache not being updated when the permissions are removed. This was fixed for the web interface in CONF-6733, but not for the RPC method.

Workaround is to flush caches via the web interface after removing the group, or restart Confluence.
fields.summary: Fix CONF-6733 for RPC method removeGroup()
